speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Niles. [_She sits._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, how's Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I just got back from visiting her at the spa.  It wasn't easy, but she's already lost nine pounds and twelve ounces.  [_N.B. This is an inside joke.  Jane Leeves had her baby, Isabella Catherine Coben, weighing in at nine pounds and twelve ounces._]

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, good for her!  It's all about willpower. [_N.B. First appearance of James, the "unflappable" barista/waiter._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Um, I'm going back to the spa this coming weekend, if you need a ride...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, these aren't for me.  Alice's school is having a picnic and I'm bringing the goodies.

speaker: Niles
text: [_looking at her cleavage_] Yes, I see.  Just don't get them sunburned. [_off her look_] I'm sorry, it's just... aren't you a little overdressed for a picnic? _Roz gets a Tupperware container out of her bag and puts the brownies in it._

speaker: Roz
text: Well, there is this cute single dad named Greg.  He's going through a divorce, his wife cheated on him.  He's so nice, too.  He deserves a woman he can trust.  Do these look like I baked them?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Just as long as they don't taste like you baked them.

speaker: Roz
text: I gotta go.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to server_] Can I get a latte to go, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Niles, it's official: our old high school is on the verge of bankruptcy.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what happened to the fundraising committee?

speaker: Frasier
text: We disbanded it this morning.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe it.  Bryce Academy gone.  No more third floor library.  No more science lab.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh.  I stole my first kiss in that science lab.  Jill Solomon.  She was pretty upset about it, but I was beaming all the way to the nurse's office.

speaker: Niles
text: No more nurse's office!  I spent many a happy gym class there. Frasier, we can't let this happen.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see how we can prevent it, Niles.  Believe me, there are no more alumni arms left to be twisted.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, maybe we're twisting the wrong arms.  We know plenty of people who give to any cause that comes along.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps you're right.  Let's get some of that cash flowing Bryce's way!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  Now, how soon do you think we can get some of our well- to-do friends together?

speaker: Frasier
text: No time to waste, Niles.  How's Wednesday evening?

speaker: Niles
text: I can't, theater tickets.  How 'bout Thursday?

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got an appointment at the spa.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, can you change it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not willingly.  It's with the good masseur, the blind one.

speaker: Niles
text: He's blind?!  When they said he couldn't see clients, I thought he was just booked all week. _They exit.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Niles and Frasier are preparing for the party.  There are servers helping._

speaker: Niles
text: Now, we should probably talk strategy before the guests get here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right.  We don't want to pounce.  Let's let them get settled in, have a few cocktails, and when they're sufficiently relaxed comfortable, we'll shear them like Delilah!

speaker: Niles
text: Our first guest.

speaker: Frasier
text: Let the fundraising begin! _He opens the door to reveal a group of people.  He ushers them in, shaking hands and greeting._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, one and all.  Please, come in, come in, please. Let me take your coat.  Please, make yourself at home.

speaker: Guest
text: Frasier, the place looks wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Guest
text: I love that painting!

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, it's hardly as impressive as that portrait Hockney did of your wife.

speaker: Guest
text: You like it?  Make me an offer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Guest
text: Between you and me, I'm getting hammered by margin calls. Need a watch?

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, that's not... [_He breaks off and goes to greet the new guest._] Mertzie!  Good to see you.  How is everything?

speaker: 2nd Guest
text: So the judge voided the pre-nup and if that's not enough on top of it, I'm paying half her lawyer's fee.  These Russian gals look good on the internet, but... _The scene DISSOLVES to later.  Frasier finishes with a guest and walks over to Niles._

speaker: Niles
text: How are things going on your side of the room?

speaker: Frasier
text: Not very well.  It seems Marshall sank all his money in a new house.  Sally sank all her money in a new boat.  Which sank.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait!  Niles, at the door, isn't that...?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes it is.  Eleanor Lynch.  I hear she got a huge settlement from the Mariners after that bat flew into the stands and...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, the woman next to her.  Isn't that Penelope Janvier?

speaker: Niles
text: Of the Penelope Janvier Foundation?  Yes, it is!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is amazing luck.  She could write a check covering the whole amount without batting an eye!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  Don't put it that way in front of Eleanor.  Let's go talk to her.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, wait.  We're only going to have one crack at this, we better make it a good one.  Let's devise a little plan, come with me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, all right. _They head to the kitchen.  One of the servers, stepping down from the raised floor, twists her foot and cries out.  Penelope hurries over._

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, my goodness.  Are you all right?

speaker: Server
text: Oh, I just twisted my ankle.

speaker: Penelope
text: Well, sit down, I'll take this back to the kitchen for you.

speaker: Server
text: Oh, thank you. _Penelope starts to walk over, but Martin pokes his head out of the hallway._

speaker: Martin
text: Psst.  Hey, sweetheart.  I need some more Crunch 'n' Munch.

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, I'm not...

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry.  I'm sure your busy, but if my sons see me traipsing through their party, they'll think I'm gonna embarrass them in front of all their stuffed-shirt friends. [_He takes a cracker from the tray she's holding._] You look familiar.  You ever dance?

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, we've got to appear casual.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  Should we start with a little small talk?

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps, perhaps.  Yes.  I remember an aphorism that's usually attributed to Santayana, but I have my own little version...

speaker: Niles
text: We've go to get out there right now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Just give me the chance to get the words right.  "Money can not so enrich a man..."

speaker: Niles
text: She's talking to Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's get the hell out there! _They hurry out.  CUT TO: the living room as they rush over to see Martin closing the door behind Penelope._

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, Dad, what happened with that woman just now?

speaker: Martin
text: Nothin'.  She got a phone call and she had to leave.  She said to say thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, come off it.  You offended her somehow.

speaker: Frasier
text: What was it, Dad?  A bawdy joke?  Nose whistling?

speaker: Niles
text: Do you have any idea who that was?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, she said her name was Penelope John Veer or Jeen Veeair or somethin'...

speaker: Frasier
text: Janvier, Dad, _Jean, JEAN_!  Oh, it doesn't matter.

speaker: Martin
text: Well it does to me.  I wanna say her name right if we're havin' dinner tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: You didn't ask her out, did you Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: No, she asked me out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Dad, it's just that I'm a little shocked.

speaker: Martin
text: Actually, I think that's pronounced "Sorry, Dad, I'm a condescending jaque-ass." **THE SILVER FOX** _Scene 3 - Frasier's Apartment  Fade in.  Frasier and Niles are eating at the table._

speaker: Niles
text: Dad left to meet Penelope five hours ago.  What could they be doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: I can think of one possibility.

speaker: Niles
text: You think...?  On a first date?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, they went to a steak house.  Penelope's paying.  I'm sorry, but I don't think a forty-eight-ouncer is out of the question. _He grabs the plates and he and Niles head to the kitchen. CUT TO: the kitchen as they enter._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, hard to believe but Penelope Janvier could actually become Dad's girlfriend.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's not so preposterous.  Mom was as cultured and intelligent as they come, and he certainly made her happy.

speaker: Frasier
text: That he did. You know it might be good for Dad, too. [_He takes a sherry from Niles._] Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah.  It certainly won't hurt our fundraising efforts. [_raises his glass_] For Bryce.

speaker: Frasier
text: For Bryce.

speaker: Niles
text: He's back!  Is that a woman's voice?

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!  She came home with him!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, hey, how was your evening?

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, couldn't have gone better.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, am I mistaken, or did we just hear the sound of a woman's voice out here?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, she's in the powder room, but listen...

speaker: Frasier
text: The powder room!  I haven't changed the hand towels for three days!

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't you cluck your tongue at me! _He hurries over as the powder room door opens and a woman, not Penelope, comes out._

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, Estelle, I'd like you to meet my boys.  This is Frasier and Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Estelle
text: Nice to meet you guys.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Estelle
text: Thanks for lettin' me use the john.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, sure.  See you tomorrow, okay?

speaker: Estelle
text: Great.

speaker: Estelle
text: Bye guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm beat.  Well, see you guys tomorrow. Both: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right, here's what happened.  Penelope and I got along great, but after I dropped her off, I was still hungry. So I went to this little coffee shop near McGinty's for chili fries.  Now, I know what you're wondering: doesn't McGinty's have chili fries?  Yes, and they're very tasty, but...

speaker: Frasier
text: Who the hell is Estelle?!

speaker: Martin
text: She works in the coffee shop.  We got to chattin' and the next thing you know, we're havin' a nightcap at McGinty's. Hey, when it rains, it pours.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Dad, but what about Penelope?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm seein' her Tuesday.

speaker: Niles
text: You just made a date with Estelle.

speaker: Martin
text: Not for Tuesday.

speaker: Niles
text: You're going to date both of them?  Are you sure that's wise?

speaker: Martin
text: It's just dating.  I met 'em both at the same time, I like 'em both.  Where's the harm in it?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't you think that's a bit risky?  What if one of them should find out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Penelope for example.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, yes, you wouldn't want to alienate her permanently.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't worry.  I've watched you juggle.  I got a pretty good handle on what not to do. _Frasier is left without a comeback.  FADE OUT.  End of Act 1  Act 2  Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa  Fade in.   Niles comes to the counter for some sugar, Roz is there, dressed up._

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hi, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.  Off to another picnic, I see.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, Greg and I are really hitting it off.  He loves my cooking. _Niles heads back to the window seat where Frasier is sitting. The Waiter comes up to Roz._

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry, ma'am, we're out of lemon bars.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, make some more.  And give me a dirty pan.  I need to put it in my sink.

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry, our baker doesn't come in 'til tomorrow.  I can give you the recipe.

speaker: Roz
text: What am I supposed to do with that?

speaker: Waiter
text: Bake?

speaker: Roz
text: Is that supposed to be funny? _CUT TO: Niles and Frasier at the window bench.  Martin comes in and heads for the counter as Frasier folds his newspaper over._

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, Niles, you won't believe this.  Bryce trustees are already reviewing a proposal for the purchase of their land.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad just walked in.  Let's drop another hint about meeting Penelope.

speaker: Frasier
text: The time for hints is passed, Niles.  We've got to be direct.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad is not going to let us ask his girlfriend for money.

speaker: Frasier
text: I didn't say "honest," I said "direct."  Try to keep up, for God's sake!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, have a seat.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, wow!  Is that espresso?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, a little pick-me-up in between dates.  This juggling thing isn't as easy as I make it look.  But don't you worry: they're both gettin' first class passage on the "S.S. Martin."

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, THAT'S where you get that from. _A cell phone begins chiming "The William Tell Overture."  Frasier and Niles check theirs, but Martin reaches in his pocket._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's me.

speaker: Frasier
text: You got a cell phone?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, sure, I had to.  You don't think I gave them both my home number, do you?  Come on, Fras, that's amateur hour. See, I programmed the phone for different rings depending on who's calling, so that way I don't get caught off guard. Now, this is "William Tell", rhymes with "Estelle."

speaker: Martin
text: Hello? ... Oh, hi, Este... nelope!

speaker: Martin
text: Penelope, that's right!  Her son's name's William. [_into phone_] Uh, yeah.  Oh, sure, Tuesday sounds great!  Pick me up at seven?  Okay.  See you then, Penelope.

speaker: Niles
text: Very smooth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  Dad, about Penelope, actually, we were wondering...

speaker: Martin
text: Now see, that's Estelle. [_He answers._] Hello?  Hey, Estelle, I had a feeling it might be you.  Tuesday at seven?  Sounds great.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, hold on a sec. [_to them_] What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't you just make a date for Tuesday at seven with Penelope?

speaker: Martin
text: That was Thursday, wasn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, we both heard Tuesday.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, thanks.  Boy, that coulda been ugly. [_into phone_] Estelle, sorry no, Thursday's out.  It has to be Tuesday. [_The boys gesture again._] No, wait, uh, no, Thursday.  Thursday's what I meant.  Yeah, okay.  Talk to you later.  Bye.

speaker: Martin
text: She's got it bad and that ain't good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, listen, we were thinking it might be time that we meet Penelope.  She sounds enchanting.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, enchanting.  How's tomorrow?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, guys, I don't know.  Meetin' the family, that's taking it up another notch.  I'm not sure if I want to get that serious yet.  Maybe in a few months, but right now I want to keep it simple.

speaker: Niles
text: Simple?  As in "Estenelope"?

speaker: Martin
text: Hello... Who's that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, for God's sake!  Isn't there enough on your plate as it is?

speaker: Martin
text: What can I tell you, Daddy's got a big appetite!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God, what'll we do now?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  I guess we could have him neutered.  Well, I suppose we could try to get to Penelope through her foundation.

speaker: Frasier
text: I already tried that, but there's a six-month waiting list just to see her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, Dad must have left his phone.  Maybe I better run and tell him it's Penelope.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'll never catch him.

speaker: Niles
text: No, he's long gone and would probably want you to take a message.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  No, this is his son, Frasier.  Penelope Janvier? Oh, how nice to speak with you.  A cocktail party, tomorrow night.  He'll be there.  In fact, I'll make sure of that, I'll be driving him myself.  You see, my brother Niles and I will be with him all day.  It's our once a year family day and we do just about everything together.  What's that?  Are you sure, really?  Well, then yes, we'd love to come. **CHECK, PLEASE** Fade in.  Frasier, Niles and Martin come in and take off their coats.

speaker: Frasier
text: My, Penelope certainly has good taste.

speaker: Niles
text: Well of course, she likes Dad, doesn't she?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, can it.  I'm still mad at you guys for inviting yourselves.  Now, remember, be careful what you say in front of Penelope.  I've got a delicate balancing act going here, so don't mess it up.

speaker: Penelope
text: Don't mess what up?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, ah, uh, your lovely living room, my boys really like to rough-house.

speaker: Martin
text: Penelope, these are my sons, Niles and Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, hello, we spoke on the phone.  It's such a pleasure to meet you.

speaker: Penelope
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad speaks about you all the time.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes. _Martin's cell phone begins chiming "Railroad," he reaches for it nervously._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, uh, that's just my alarm, to remind me to... take my pills.

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, well, let's get you a glass of water.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, no, that's all right, I'd rather do it in private.

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, he has trouble swallowing.

speaker: Frasier
text: A small epiglottis.

speaker: Niles
text: "Epiglottis."  Haven't heard that word since biology class in high school.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, high school.  It's a pity about our old high school...

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, William!

speaker: Penelope
text: Niles, Frasier, I'd like you to meet my son, William.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, hello.

speaker: William
text: [_deadpan_] Nice to meet you.

speaker: Penelope
text: These are Marty's boys.

speaker: William
text: [_deadpan_] Oh, hi. [_to Penelope_] Did I just hear Doctor Kallman asked you for fifty thousand dollars for a new CAT scan machine at the hospital?

speaker: Penelope
text: It is a worthy cause.

speaker: William
text: Yes, Mother, they all are.  But it's inappropriate to hit you up for money at a party.

speaker: Penelope
text: Teddy was your father's closest friend.

speaker: William
text: Bourbon was my father's closest friend.  I showed Ted out.

speaker: Penelope
text: William!  He delivered you.  Excuse me, I have to go get him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right.

speaker: William
text: People look at my mother, all they see is dollar signs. Makes me sick.  What are you guys doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Us?  Oh, well, actually, your mother invited us here.

speaker: Niles
text: She did.

speaker: William
text: Uh-oh.  Mother's been cornered by Father Patterson.  Or should I say, "Father Sponge"?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my goodness.  It's going to be hard pressing our case to Penelope with him around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't worry, Niles, we'll get a chance.  We've got all night.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't get too comfortable, boys, we've gotta leave.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it turns out I had a date with Estelle tonight, she's been waitin' half an hour.  It's not like me to screw up like this.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what about Penelope, Dad?  You cannot just walk out on her party.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Estelle took the evening off special just to be with me, you know, and she's pretty steamed.  Rules of the game: angriest woman wins.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good lord.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, geez!  Grab your coats.

speaker: Penelope
text: Frasier?  Where's your father off to?

speaker: Frasier
text: He, he had to take more pills.

speaker: Penelope
text: My goodness, I had no idea he was on so much medication. Are you concerned?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not really, no.  He'll be fine.  I just wish I could same the same for our old high school.

speaker: William
text: What are you three taking about?

speaker: Niles
text: Umm, William, there you are.  Excuse us. [_Niles takes his arm and leads him away._] I just wanted to alert you to a possible situation.  I overheard one of the servers discussing a one-act play he wanted your mother to produce.

speaker: William
text: Okay, which one?

speaker: Niles
text: I think it was something by Chekhov.

speaker: Frasier
text: The long and the short of it, Ms. Janvier, is, is that my alma mater, Bryce Academy, is in dire straights.  The coffers are bare, and our only hope is to find a savior.  Forgive me for being presumptuous, but I was hoping it might be you.

speaker: Penelope
text: Actually, I'm familiar with Bryce.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well then you must also be familiar with their excellent standards.

speaker: Penelope
text: Yes, I am.  They wouldn't let in William.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, with your endowment, I'm sure he'd be a shoe-in. I, I'm sorry, Ms. Jean Vie, please, we are desperate.

speaker: Penelope
text: Ordinarily, I wouldn't even consider this, but... I'm very fond of your father.  Call the foundation tomorrow with the details and we'll issue you a check.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, thank you.  That's very kind of you, thank you so much.

speaker: Penelope
text: It's my pleasure.  I'd do anything for your father.  He's a rarity: he's an old-fashioned gentleman.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I gotta go.

speaker: Penelope
text: Marty, what's wrong?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm feelin' a little under the weather.

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, well then maybe you ought to see my doctor.  He's here at the party.

speaker: Martin
text: No, I don't need a doctor.

speaker: Penelope
text: Those were my husband's last words.  Don't move.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, if you insist.

speaker: Martin
text: Pull the car around, I'm goin' out through the kitchen.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad!  Dad!  For God's sake, you can't leave now!  Penelope will get suspicious!

speaker: Martin
text: Estelle's already suspicious.  Besides, I've decided to break it off with Penelope.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, hearing Estelle just now, how upset she was on the phone, it made me realize how much I cared about her.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, listen Dad.  Bryce Academy is going bankrupt. Penelope is going to write a check tomorrow to save it. So until then, I need you to pretend that you're still interested in her.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't believe this!  You and your brother have been using me! _His phone rings again and he reaches for it.  Penelope comes over with a man._

speaker: Penelope
text: Martin?  This is Doctor Kallman.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, well, it's nice to meet you, but I'm feeling a lot better now, thanks.

speaker: Penelope
text: If I let you leave without knowing if you're sick, I'll worry all night.

speaker: Frasier
text: And you wouldn't want that, now would you, Dad?  Here we are.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doctor, be thorough.

speaker: Martin
text: But the pants stay on!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ms. Janvier, I realize that I've been a little pushy...

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, not pushy, just assertive.  I like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, then be prepared to love me, because I need that check right now.

speaker: William
text: Was it this one, Deviled Egg Guy?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, you know I'm not sure.  He and Chicken Sate Guy look so much alike.

speaker: William
text: All right, listen up: Which one of you snack jockeys is trying to get a play produced? _All of the servers, and one of the guests, raise a hand.  CUT TO: Frasier.  Penelope comes back into the room with her checkbook._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Ms. Janvier.  Thank you again, so much.  Just make it out to "Bryce Academy."

speaker: Penelope
text: Do you have a pen?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, when you sign as many autographs as I do, you always have to have your... oh, good lord, I'm...

speaker: Penelope
text: Never mind. [_calling out_] William, I need a pen.

speaker: William
text: What for?

speaker: Penelope
text: I'm writing a check.

speaker: William
text: Oh, that's it.  Look, we're going down to the "special" room, and we're going to talk about this. _He starts to walk over, but Niles hurries around and faints into his arms._

speaker: William
text: Mother, I...

speaker: William
text: Mother, I forbid you to write another check.

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, just give me a pen.

speaker: William
text: I don't have one.

speaker: William
text: Mother...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.

speaker: William
text: ...this could be an elaborate scheme to bilk us.  You don't even know who these guys are.

speaker: Frasier
text: We're Marty's boys.

speaker: Penelope
text: And I trust Martin.

speaker: Penelope
text: Oh, that's Martin's alarm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just ignore that.

speaker: Penelope
text: This is a phone!

speaker: Niles
text: Here, I'll take it.

speaker: Penelope
text: Hello?  This is Penelope, who is this?  Estelle, Martin's girlfriend?

speaker: Penelope
text: May I take a message?

speaker: Martin
text: Pill time!  Time for more pills.

speaker: Penelope
text: I'll tell him. [_She closes the phone._] Estelle says don't bother coming over tonight.  Oh, Marty, how could you?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm sorry.  I was gonna tell you, but... I guess this means breakfast Tuesday is off?

speaker: Penelope
text: That's right.  And it was Thursday!

speaker: Penelope
text: I don't need this pen anymore.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ms. Janvier, please.  I don't blame you for being angry, but if you believe in the hope of tomorrow and a brighter future, then please, please don't punish the children of Bryce Academy for our misdeeds.

speaker: William
text: Oh, boo-hoo.

speaker: William
text: Mother!

speaker: Penelope
text: That's enough, William.  I made a promise to these men, and I'm a woman of my word.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.  Thank you so much!

speaker: Niles
text: You're more gracious than we deserve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Well done, Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, I can't wait to see the expression on the headmaster's face when he sees this check for... [_he looks at it_] ...fifty dollars.

speaker: Niles
text: What?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, well, I, I guess it's fifty dollars more than we had before.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, let's go fellas, grab my coat, will ya?

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, Dad. _Frasier grabs the coat.  But, when he turns around, the coat knocks a vase off a table.  He and Niles look at it, panicked.  Then Frasier puts the check down on the table and they slink out quickly.  FADE OUT_
